Catalan food is very good.  But if you're used to eating a variety of cuisines, you will eventually crave something different.  Something without surprise slices of ham or anchovy, perhaps.  On a night like that, American Tourist, you will really appreciate La Tagliatella.  La Tagliatella is a chain restaurant, and the decor takes a page from the American Franchise Handbook (i.e., lots of framed art, pasta in frames, faux aged paint, etc.), but in a way that's not too silly.  There are locations all over Barcelona, but this one is right around the corner from the Mutaner Metro station.  And you won't feel too badly about being such an Ugly American when you realize that everyone else in the restaurant is Spanish.  They like this place, too.The service is warm and efficient.  The food is fresh and DELICIOUS.  And the portions are huge.  Splitting your pasta would not be a bad idea.  But if you don't, they'll actually give you a doggie bag. This may be the only place in Europe that will.  I felt like a conspicuous American jackhole carrying my logo plastic  bag out of the restaurant, but the rest of that gorgonzola parpadelle and I had a date with destiny.  Tomorrow.  At lunchtime.
